question: How would you describe your ideal job?

options.description: Ability to decide for myself what to do and how to do it
Being told what to do, but not how to do it
Being told what to do, and getting suggestions on how to do it
Being clearly told what to do and how to do it

question: In the past, what did you do when you were working on something and nothing seemed to go right?

options.description: I took a break from working to relax and started again some time later.
I continued working, but I was frustrated and upset.
I let others know I was angry, then I began to feel better and continued working.
I took the day as it came and tried to remain upbeat.
I stopped what I was doing, figuring things would go better the next day.

question: Q15 The high school subject in which I received my lowest grades was:
What has been the major cause of your failures?
